qas.question: A large problem in the study of early Buddhism is the relationship of dhyana and what else?
Liberating insight is attained after mastering what?
Later edition of texts such as what has the Rupa Jhanas?

context: A core problem in the study of early Buddhism is the relation between dhyana and <a0_0>insight<a0_0/>. Schmithausen, in his often-cited article On some Aspects of Descriptions or Theories of 'Liberating Insight' and 'Enlightenment' in Early Buddhism notes that the mention of the four noble truths as constituting "liberating insight", which is attained after mastering the <a1_0>Rupa Jhanas<a1_0/>, is a later addition to texts such as <a2_0>Majjhima Nikaya<a2_0/> 36.[page needed]
